channel.title: Java 7
channel.description:
http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/ http://openjdk.java.net/projects/jdk7/features/
JDK 7: General Availability 2011/07/28 08:06:37 -07:00 Last week the JCP Ex­ec­u­tive Com­mit­tee ap­proved Java SE 7 and its com­po­nent JSRs. This week the first and only Re­lease Can­di­date passed all its tests with fly­ing col­ors. After 9,494 bug fixes, 1,966 en­hance­ments, 9,018 change­sets, 147 builds, and four JSRs, JDK 7 is done. A giant thank-you to every­one who con­tributed to this re­lease—from Sun, Or­a­cle, and else­where—and es­pe­cially to those who held on for the long haul of four years, seven months, and sev­en­teen days since JDK 6. Enjoy!
On a side note : Oracle needs to gtfo. Glad to see some progression :D Discuss.

item.title: Java 7
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

lmfao, 5 years and they really haven’t come up with as much as i was hoping. at least the nio extras and fork/join look interesting

wait, oh god it’s crippled http://www.lucidimagination.com/blog/2011/07/28/dont-use-java-7-for-anything/

item.title: Java 7
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

http://download.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/

http://openjdk.java.net/projects/jdk7/features/

JDK 7: General Availability 2011/07/28 08:06:37 -07:00

Last week the JCP Ex­ec­u­tive Com­mit­tee ap­proved Java SE 7 and its com­po­nent JSRs.

This week the first and only Re­lease Can­di­date passed all its tests with fly­ing col­ors.

After 9,494 bug fixes, 1,966 en­hance­ments, 9,018 change­sets, 147 builds, and four JSRs, JDK 7 is done.

A giant thank-you to every­one who con­tributed to this re­lease—from Sun, Or­a­cle, and else­where—and es­pe­cially to those who held on for the long haul of four years, seven months, and sev­en­teen days since JDK 6.

Enjoy!

On a side note : Oracle needs to gtfo.
Glad to see some progression
Discuss.

Read full topic
